name: recount
content:
recount verb [T]
(DESCRIBE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to describe how something happened, or to tell a story: He recounted his adventures since he had left home. [ + question word ] He was fond of recounting how he had played professional football when he was 19.

recount verb [T]
(DESCRIBE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to describe the particular events of an experience, or to tell a story: She recounted some of her experiences working as a nurse in a hospital emergency room.
recount noun [C]
(COUNT)
a second or another count, esp. of the number of votes in an election: The final vote was so close that they demanded a recount.
